intro: Jatropha velutina, commonly known as velvet leaf jatropha, is a shrub or small tree native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its hairy, velvety leaves that give it its common name. The plant produces clusters of yellow flowers followed by orange-red berries containing toxic seeds. It is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions. Its botanical features make it a notable species in ecological and horticultural contexts.
